column2: Role & responsibilities     We are seeking a highly skilled and compassionate Neurologist to join our team and provide exceptional healthcare to our patients. As a Neurologist, you will utilize your extensive knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and the central nervous system to diagnose and treat disorders of the brain, spinal cord, and nervous system. Your responsibilities will include ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests, developing treatment plans, and collaborating with a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals. With your expertise and attention to detail, you will ensure that our patients receive the best possible care and support in a high-stress environment. Join us in making a meaningful impact on the lives of individuals with neurological conditions.   Responsibilities Prescribe and/or administer treatment and medication related to neurological disorders Monitor the behavioral and cognitive side effects of treatment and medication Order supportive care services for patients Participate in neuroscience research activities Liaise with medical professionals in the community and other hospitals Preferred candidate profile   Qualification Required- MBBS+DNB/DM Perks and benefits   Best In The Industry.

column2: FIRST NEURO HOSPITAL is looking for CONSULTANT NEUROLOGIST to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey        A neurologist is a medical doctor who specializes in treating disorders of the nervous system      This includes the brain, spinal cord, nerves, and muscles      Their expertise covers a wide range of conditions such as epilepsy, Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, multiple sclerosis, strokes, and various types of headaches      Neurologists often perform neurological examinations, order and interpret diagnostic tests like MRI or EEG scans, and prescribe medications or other treatments to manage neurological conditions      Additionally, they may collaborate with other healthcare professionals, such as neurosurgeons or physical therapists, to provide comprehensive care for their patients

column2: 1. Diagnose complex neurological problems by listening to the patients history, as well as by examining them and using appropriate neurological tests   2. Run outpatient clinics, where youll mainly see patients with a chronic condition, i.e. a disease that takes a long time to develop such as Parkinsons and multiple sclerosis, or diagnose rare diseases   3. Complete ward rounds where youll look after a caseload of inpatients   4. Treat acute conditions, i.e. those that come on suddenly, such as a stroke   5. Handle the opd and Ipd patient,taking ipd rounds.

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Senior Technician Neurology?to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     As a Senior Technician in Neurology, you will play a crucial role in supporting neurologists and healthcare professionals in the diagnosis, treatment, and monitoring of neurological conditions     Your responsibilities include conducting neurodiagnostic tests, managing equipment, and assisting in patient care     This role requires technical expertise in neurology procedures and a commitment to providing high-quality healthcare services       Key Responsibilities:       Neurodiagnostic Testing:Perform and assist in various neurodiagnostic tests, such as EEG (electroencephalography), EMG (electromyography), and nerve conduction studies     Set up and calibrate equipment for accurate test results     Patient Preparation:Prepare patients for neurodiagnostic procedures, explaining the process and addressing any concerns     Ensure patient comfort and cooperation during tests     Data Collection and Analysis:Record and analyze neurophysiological data obtained during diagnostic tests     Generate reports for neurologists and healthcare providers     Equipment Maintenance:Maintain and troubleshoot neurodiagnostic equipment     Ensure the proper functioning and calibration of machines     Patient Monitoring:Monitor patients during neurodiagnostic tests to ensure safety and accurate data collection     Recognize and respond to any adverse events or complications     Collaboration with Healthcare Team:Collaborate with neurologists, physicians, and other healthcare professionals     Provide technical support and communicate relevant information     Quality Assurance:Implement quality control measures to ensure the accuracy and reliability of test results     Adhere to regulatory standards and protocols in neurodiagnostic testing     Patient Education:Educate patients on the purpose and process of neurodiagnostic tests     Provide information on post-procedure care and follow-up instructions     Documentation:Maintain accurate and complete records of neurodiagnostic procedures     Enter patient information and test results into electronic medical records     Continuing Education:Stay updated on advancements in neurology and neurodiagnostic technologies     Participate in training and educational programs to enhance skills

column2: Aster Medcity is looking for Resident - Neurology to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     As a Resident in Neurology, your primary role is to undergo specialized training and gain hands-on experience in diagnosing, treating, and managing neurological disorders and conditions     Neurology is a medical specialty that focuses on the study and treatment of diseases and disorders affecting the brain, spinal cord, nerves, and muscles       Here is a general job description for a Resident in Neurology:       Patient Evaluation: You will be responsible for conducting thorough patient evaluations, including taking detailed medical histories, performing physical examinations, and ordering and interpreting diagnostic tests such as imaging studies, electroencephalograms (EEGs), electromyograms (EMGs), and nerve conduction studies     Diagnosis and Treatment: You will work closely with attending physicians and senior neurologists to diagnose and develop treatment plans for patients with various neurological conditions, such as epilepsy, stroke, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, Alzheimer's disease, neuromuscular disorders, and headaches     This involves analyzing test results, reviewing medical literature, and considering the patient's symptoms and medical history     Procedures and Interventions: Depending on your level of training and the specific program, you may have the opportunity to perform certain procedures under supervision     These may include lumbar punctures, nerve blocks, electromyography, and other diagnostic tests or interventions     Patient Management: You will be responsible for managing and monitoring patients' conditions, adjusting treatment plans as necessary, and providing ongoing care and support     This includes prescribing and managing medications, coordinating with other healthcare professionals, and providing patient education     Research and Education: As a resident, you may have opportunities to participate in research projects, present findings at conferences, and contribute to scientific publications     You will also be involved in teaching medical students and other healthcare professionals     Collaboration: You will work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team, which may include other physicians, nurses, therapists, and technicians, to provide comprehensive care for patients     Effective communication and teamwork skills are essential in this role
column11: Neurology

column2: Perform surgery on the brain, spinal cord and peripheral nerves to remove tumors, relieve chronic pain and treat wounds, vascular disorders and diseases such as Parkinsons and epilepsy.    Perform surgery to relieve hydrocephalus, the abnormal build-up of cerebrovascular fluid in the brain.    You may focus on the correction of deformities and treatment of diseases of the spinal cord such as degenerative spine disorder and scoliosis. Other areas like sub-specialization include pediatric neurosurgery and radiosurgery and use by radiation to treat tumors.    Work effectively in a multidisciplinary team, collaborating and liaising closely with colleagues.    Provide support and advice to colleagues working in other specialties.    Practice governance and audits within your department.    Complete administration, which can include anything from accurately recording patient interventions and referrals to overseeing budgetary information.    Teach and provide educational support and training for junior staff
column11: Training, Junior Staff, DNB, Neurosurgery, Auditing, Teaching
